subject: Re: [junit] Location of test files
msgSnippet: From: Ray Tayek  ... in ... copy ... within ... I do exactly the same for hard coded test data files. The other alternative is to
messageBody:
From: "Ray Tayek" <rtayek@...>
> Hi, I have this package that requires a lot of test files, so I put them
in
> com/foo/package/testfiles. I then use class.getresource and decode url or
> open as input stream to read them (stuck with jaca 1.3). This requires a
> copy in ant so they can be found and works fine. Eclipse seems happy to
copy
> them as resources to the build directory. So so far, no real problemsas we
> can build and run from the command line using ant, by using ant from
within
> eclipse and jut by using eclipse sans ant. Eventually we want to put this
> into cvs.
>
I do exactly the same for hard coded test data files. The other alternative
is to generate the test files on the fly using the java temp file facility.

- Neil Swingler
